At the end of the day, if you still consider buying this, I would just say be prepared for some annoying gimmicks and an expensive battery replacement, without the original Apple box, charger, and band that it came with (they'll all be off brand). Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2022
Data:
Pros:
- This is for my used watch, each is different -
• Affordable compared to new
• Mine had no visible signs of wear
Cons:
- These are for a used watch -
• No instruction manual
• Battery charger doesn’t work
• No care in packaging
This is my very FIRST Apple Watch, so there’s been a bit of a learning curve. The first 3 days was literally a headache. I almost returned it.
On the surface…everything looked great. There were no visible signs of wear. No scratches or flaws.
However, mine didn’t come with a user manual or instructions, so setting it up was a little difficult. Luckily, my iPhone was able to walk me through the process. I had to update my software on the iPhone, so it was a longer process. Once I got them both synced everything “seemed” to be working fine. However, the battery life drained within a few hours. I charged it overnight, but it only charged to 60%, and would rapidly drain. I scoured the internet to see what the problems might be. Deleted Apps, lowered brightness, turned on backup power reserve, etc. My last ditch effort before returning was to buy a different charger……and Voila…it worked! I also got a message to update the watch software once I plugged it into the new charger, so that may have also been the problem. So, the charger that mine came with was a dud. I imagine that might be the case for a lot of others since I’m seeing a lot of reviews about the battery life now.
The good news is that it’s working like a dream now! It charges to 100% now, and my battery lasts all day!
Overall, I’m happy that I finally made the leap to get an Apple Watch. I’ve had it for a month now, and I’m still finding new things to do with it. If you’re struggling with battery life on your watch I hope you found my comments helpful!

Data:

I wanted to buy from Apple, but the cheapest refurbished watch they had was $339.00 and I'm just unwilling to pay those prices for a watch. Despite this being a 4 year old watch, it doesn't feel like a 4 year old watch. It's new TO ME. I like the new features (ECG, the slightly bigger screen DOES make a difference .. I always put my passcode in wrong at least 2x with the Series 2, with this that issue is gone).
I'll revisit this review after I've had it a while, or uncovered answers to any of my other issues. As a note, my seller was The Camera Guyz in Brooklyn NY. My delivery date was initially towards the end of next week, next Thursday (I ordered yesterday, Friday)... watch came within 24 hours.

Data: Terrible and disappointing. The watch arrived quicker than expected, which was nice. There was a sticker on the back of the watch that was a real pain to get off. I started the process for a return and it showed me a video on how to fix the issue. I tried the solution it offered and it did seem to do the trick. Data: Overall I’m thrilled. I couldn’t afford a new watch, so this was a great option. MINOR damage to the screen, but it doesn’t bother me at all. My one complaint is that the battery life sucks. I take it off the charger at 6:30AM and by 5:30PM it’s on 10%. My 3rd generation lasted a day and a half at least, so it’s something I’ve had to get used to. It does charge fast, though, so if you have 10-20 minutes mid-day for a quick charge, you won’t have a problem. Data:
This is more of an FYI rather than a review. Apple incorrectly lists ALL series 4 models as having sapphire glass. THIS IS NOT TRUE. The aluminum case models come with Ion-X glass which is NOT as scratch resistant as sapphire. I purchased a 4 series with an aluminum case and confirmed with a Diamond Selector (used to test diamonds, but is commonly used to test watch glass) that it does not have sapphire. See the attached video. I compared the Apple watch to two other Citizen watches. The one on the left has a mineral crystal, the one in the middle has a sapphire crystal. Red means sapphire, NO red means something else (Mineral, Gorilla, Ion-X etc.).
Now, Ion-X glass is not necessarily a bad thing. Sapphire glass is FAR more scratch resistant than Ion-X. However, Ion-X is FAR more shatter resistant. If you are going to be hard on your watch like working manual labor, constantly hitting it against hard objects, prone to dropping, then you should go with the Ion-X glass. Yes it is going to scratch on you, but it is much less likely to completely break/shatter. If you are simply wearing it for everyday activities with no regular threat of smashing or dropping it, then you should go with sapphire. There is still the possibility of it shattering when dropped or hit on a hard surface, but it will remain virtually scratch-free.
